title: Lead Migrations Solutions Architect
content:
(FEQ324R133)
 
At Databricks, we are passionate about enabling data teams to solve the world's toughest problems. Our customers leverage the Databricks Data Intelligence Platform to power their mission-critical Data and AI applications to improve how their organisations leverage data and insights to make better decisions faster. Customers rely on Databricks for the full range of data workloads, including data engineering, ETL, near real-time streaming, machine learning and advanced analytics.
 
Mission:
As a Lead Migrations Solutions Architect you will;

Be a deep technical expert in Enterprise Data Warehousing (EDW) and in how customers can be successful with these use-cases on the Databricks Data Intelligence Platform.
Work closely with customers, Databricks product team and the Global Databricks customer-facing technical field to develop architectures and solutions using our platform and APIs.
Bring your expertise in EDW to build scalable and reusable assets to help guide customers through the competitive landscape, best practices, implementation and develop technical champions along the way.
Provide thought leadership on best practices for migration of EDW workloads to the lakehouse.
Support enablement activities for the EMEA technical field and drive the EMEA chapter of the relevant SME group(s).
Drive customer success through direct engagement and scale your expertise across EMEA.

 
Databricks Field Engineering works with our current and future customers to grow adoption, win technical validations and advise customers on Databricks Lakehouse best practices.
The Lead Migrations Solutions Architect will own the enablement and escalations within the Global Field Engineering team around EDW migrations.
The position will report directly to the Sr. Director Product Specialists Databricks Field Engineering.
 
The impact you will have:

Deliver thought leadership and best practices in Data Warehousing and in particular in migrating data warehousing workloads from legacy tools to the Databricks Lakehouse Platform, ranging from architectural and security design to development and deployment approaches.
Provide guidance for large-scale enterprise data warehouse migrations, serving as a trusted technical advisor to senior tech leads and executives.
Become a technical expert in areas such as cloud platforms, data management, performance, and architecture.
Assist Solution Architects with more advanced aspects of the technical sale including custom proof of concept content, workload sizing, and custom architectures.
Improve community adoption (through tutorials, training, hackathons, and conference presentations).

 
What we look for:

5+ years of pre-sales experience, designing and delivering Enterprise Data Warehousing and Big Data ETL Solutions in a client or customer environment.
Experienced advising customers in Data Warehousing architecture, including internal communications to anticipate blockers and address them before they become an issue.
Certification and/or demonstrated competence in the major cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure) and Big Data technologies (eg Hadoop).
Demonstrated competence in the Databricks platform including hands-on experience with Python and SQL.
Fluent in French.
Flexible to travel, up to 30-40% for the role.

 
Benefits

Private medical insurance
Private life and disability coverage
Pension Plan
Equity awards
Enhanced Parental Leaves
Fitness reimbursement
Annual career development fund
Home office & work headphones reimbursement
Business travel accident insurance
Mental wellness resources
Employee referral bonus
About Databricks
Databricks is the data and AI company. More than 10,000 organizations worldwide — including Comcast, Condé Nast, Grammarly, and over 50% of the Fortune 500 — rely on the Databricks Data Intelligence Platform to unify and democratize data, analytics and AI. Databricks is headquartered in San Francisco, with offices around the globe and was founded by the original creators of Lakehouse, Apache Spark™, Delta Lake and MLflow. To learn more, follow Databricks on Twitter, LinkedIn and Facebook.
Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
At Databricks, we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive culture where everyone can excel. We take great care to ensure that our hiring practices are inclusive and meet equal employment opportunity standards. Individuals looking for employment at Databricks are considered without regard to age, color, disability, ethnicity, family or marital status, gender identity or expression, language, national origin, physical and mental ability, political affiliation, race, religion, sexual orientation, socio-economic status, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.
 
Compliance
If access to export-controlled technology or source code is required for performance of job duties, it is within Employer's discretion whether to apply for a U.S. government license for such positions, and Employer may decline to proceed with an applicant on this basis alone.

Seeking insights on an example relevant to the Data & AI landscape

Include notes to set the context on your role, objectives, key technologies used and the outcome of the solution. 

Note: This will help provide a basis for a core part of an initial screen discussion.
questions.label: Provide a summary of an interesting/challenging Enterprise Data Warehousing / Big Data ETL architecture solution (POC) you have worked on.
